          •

          •

          •

                     ArraysFebruary 2017, pp 125â134https://doi.org/10.1145/3020078.3021748
        
            
        
               		
               
        Memory systems play a key role in the performance of FPGA applications. As FPGA deployments
                  move towards design entry points that are more serial, memory latency has become a
                  serious design consideration. For these applications, memory network ...

                  is exposed to the programmer and managed explicitly by software, are not only found
                  in typical embedded processors but also found in a class of high performance multicore
                  ...

              research-article
              
         
              April 2018
              
         
         
              Published By ACM
              
         
              
      
              
      
              
         
              
            
              Automatic code conversion for non-volatile memory
              
            
                
               
              • Jinsoo Yoo, 
                • 
               
              • Yongjun Park, 
                • 
               
              • Seongjin Lee, 
                • 
               
              • Youjip Won
                • 
            
              
            
              SAC '18: Proceedings of the 33rd Annual ACM Symposium on Applied ComputingApril 2018, pp 1071â1076https://doi.org/10.1145/3167132.3167246
              
            
              
               		
               
              Non-Volatile Memories (NVMs), such as Phase Change Memories (PCMs) and Resistive RAMs
                  (ReRAMs), have been recently proposed as a main memory due to their higher capacity
                  and low leakage power consumption compared to traditional DRAMs. In order to ...

                Applying Software-based Memory Error Correction for In-Memory Key-Value Store: Case Studies on Memcached and RAMCloud
                
            
                  
               
                • Yin Li, 
                  • 
               
                • Hao Wang, 
                  • 
               
                • Xiaoqing Zhao, 
                  •

                  • 
               
                • Tong Zhang
                  • 
            
                
            
                MEMSYS '16: Proceedings of the Second International Symposium on Memory SystemsOctober 2016, pp 268â278https://doi.org/10.1145/2989081.2989091
                
            
                
               		
               
                With the nature of being memory hungry, in-memory key-value store is fundamentally
                  subject to very high memory cost and energy consumption. Intuitively, the availability
                  of a strong memory error correction at sufficiently small redundancy overhead could
                  ...

                                  Towards software defined persistent memory: rethinking software support for heterogenous memory architectures

                                    •

                     and WorkloadsOctober 2015, Article No.: 6, pp 1â10https://doi.org/10.1145/2819001.2819004

                  center architectures, with efficiencies and performance not possible with today's
                  volatile DRAM and persistent slow storage. We present Software Defined Persistent
                  Memory,...

                  storage management becomes more and more important. To date most efforts to optimize
                  the use of memory have been directed at devising memory management strategies at ...

                                                Improving disk bandwidth-bound applications through main memory compression
                                                
            
                                                  
               
                                                • VicenÃ§ Beltran, 
                                                  • 
               
                                                • Jordi Torres, 
                                                  • 
               
                                                • Eduard AyguadÃ©
                                                  • 
            
                                                
            
                                                MEDEA '07: Proceedings of the 2007 workshop on MEmory performance: DEaling with Applications,
                     systems and architectureSeptember 2007, pp 57â63https://doi.org/10.1145/1327171.1327178
                                                
            
                                                
               		
               
                                                The objective of main memory compression techniques is to reduce the in-memory data
                  size to virtually enlarge the available memory on the system. The main benefit of
                  this technique is the reduction of slow disk I/O operations, thus improving data access
                  ...

                                                  Efficient Generation of Application Specific Memory Controllers
                                                  
            
                                                    
               
                                                  • Marco V. Natale, 
                                                    • 
               
                                                  • Matthias Jung, 
                                                    • 
               
                                                  • Kira Kraft, 
                                                    • 
               
                                                  • Frederik Lauer, 
                                                    • 
               
                                                  • Johannes Feldmann, 
                                                    • 
               
                                                  • Chirag Sudarshan, 
                                                    • 
               
                                                  • Christian Weis, 
                                                    • 
               
                                                  • Sven Krumke, 
                                                    • 
               
                                                  • Norbert Wehn
                                                    • 
            
                                                  
            
                                                  MEMSYS 2020: The International Symposium on Memory SystemsSeptember 2020, pp 233â247https://doi.org/10.1145/3422575.3422796
                                                  
            
                                                  
               		
               
                                                   The increasing gap between the bandwidth requirements of modern Systems on Chip (SoC)
                  and the I/O data rate delivered by Dynamic Random Access Memory (DRAM), known as the
                  Memory Wall, limits the performance of todayâs data-intensive applications. ...
                                                  
            
                                                  
            
                                                  
               
                                                  
                  
                                                  
                     
                                                    
                        
                                                  •

                                                      •

                                                      •

                                                    Total Citations0
                                                    
                                 
                                 
                                                    Total Downloads25
                                                    
                                 
                                                    Last 12 Months25
                                                    
                                 
                                                    Last 6 weeks5

                                                    Hardware-software co-optimization of memory management in dynamic languages
                                                    
            
                                                      
               
                                                    • Mohamed Ismail, 
                                                      • 
               
                                                    • G. Edward Suh
                                                      • 
            
                                                    
            
                                                    ISMM 2018: Proceedings of the 2018 ACM SIGPLAN International Symposium on Memory ManagementJune 2018, pp 45â58https://doi.org/10.1145/3210563.3210566
                                                    
            
                                                    
               		
               
                                                    Dynamic programming languages are becoming increasingly popular, yet often show a
                  significant performance slowdown compared to static languages. In this paper, we study
                  the performance overhead of automatic memory management in dynamic languages. We ...

                                                      Parallel application memory scheduling
                                                      
            
                                                        
               
                                                      • Eiman Ebrahimi, 
                                                        • 
               
                                                      • Rustam Miftakhutdinov, 
                                                        • 
               
                                                      • Chris Fallin, 
                                                        • 
               
                                                      • Chang Joo Lee, 
                                                        • 
               
                                                      • JosÃ© A. Joao, 
                                                        • 
               
                                                      • Onur Mutlu, 
                                                        • 
               
                                                      • Yale N. Patt
                                                        • 
            
                                                      
            
                                                      MICRO-44: Proceedings of the 44th Annual IEEE/ACM International Symposium on MicroarchitectureDecember 2011, pp 362â373https://doi.org/10.1145/2155620.2155663
                                                      
            
                                                      
               		
               
                                                      A primary use of chip-multiprocessor (CMP) systems is to speed up a single application
                  by exploiting thread-level parallelism. In such systems, threads may slow each other
                  down by issuing memory requests that interfere in the shared memory subsystem. ...

                                                          Optimal WCET-aware code selection for scratchpad memory
                                                          
            
                                                            
               
                                                          • Hui Wu, 
                                                            • 
               
                                                          • Jingling Xue, 
                                                            • 
               
                                                          • Sri Parameswaran
                                                            •

                                                          We propose the first polynomial-time code selection algorithm for minimising the worst-case
                  execution time of a non-nested loop executed on a fully pipelined processor that uses
                  scratchpad memory to replace the instruction cache.                                                               Software protection for dynamically-generated code
                                                              
            
                                                                
               
                                                              • Sudeep Ghosh, 
                                                                • 
               
                                                              • Jason Hiser, 
                                                                • 
               
                                                              • Jack W. Davidson
                                                                • 
            
                                                              
            
                                                              PPREW '13: Proceedings of the 2nd ACM SIGPLAN Program Protection and Reverse Engineering WorkshopJanuary 2013, Article No.: 1, pp 1â12https://doi.org/10.1145/2430553.2430554
                                                              
            
                                                              
               		
               
                                                              Process-level Virtual machines (PVMs) often play a crucial role in program protection.
                  In particular, virtualization-based tools like VMProtect and CodeVirtualizer have
                  been shown to provide desirable obfuscation properties (i.e., resistance to ...

                                                                Enabling run-time memory data transfer optimizations at the system level with automated
                     extraction of embedded software metadata information

                  enabling system level optimizations for embedded systems. This embedded Software Metadata information is especially important today, because several complex multi-...

                                                                  Improving spark application throughput via memory aware task co-location: a mixture of experts approach
                                                                  
            
                                                                    
               
                                                                  • Vicent Sanz Marco, 
                                                                    • 
               
                                                                  • Ben Taylor, 
                                                                    • 
               
                                                                  • Barry Porter, 
                                                                    • 
               
                                                                  • Zheng Wang
                                                                    • 
            
                                                                  
            
                                                                  Middleware '17: Proceedings of the 18th ACM/IFIP/USENIX Middleware ConferenceDecember 2017, pp 95â108https://doi.org/10.1145/3135974.3135984
                                                                  
            
                                                                  
               		
               
                                                                  Data analytic applications built upon big data processing frameworks such as Apache
                  Spark are an important class of applications. Many of these applications are not latency-sensitive
                  and thus can run as batch jobs in data centers. By running multiple ...

                                                                    Automatically Detecting "Excessive Dynamic Memory Allocations" Software Performance
                     Anti-Pattern
                                                                    
            
                                                                      
               
                                                                    • Manjula Peiris, 
                                                                      • 
               
                                                                    • James H. Hill
                                                                      • 
            
                                                                    
            
                                                                    ICPE '16: Proceedings of the 7th ACM/SPEC on International Conference on Performance EngineeringMarch 2016, pp 237â248https://doi.org/10.1145/2851553.2851563
                                                                    
            
                                                                    
               		
               
                                                                    This paper presents a methodology for automatically detecting the excessive dynamic
                  memory allocation software performance anti-pattern, which is implemented in a tool
                  named Excessive Memory Allocation Detector (EMAD). To the best of author's knowledge,
                  ...

                                                                      A low-power memory architecture with application-aware power management for motion
                     & disparity estimation in multiview video coding
                                                                      
            
                                                                        
               
                                                                      • Bruno Zatt, 
                                                                        • 
               
                                                                      • Muhammad Shafique, 
                                                                        • 
               
                                                                      • Sergio Bampi, 
                                                                        • 
               
                                                                      • JÃ¶rg Henkel
                                                                        • 
            
                                                                      
            
                                                                      ICCAD '11: Proceedings of the International Conference on Computer-Aided DesignNovember 2011, pp 40â47
                                                                      
            
                                                                      
               		
               
                                                                      A low-power architecture for an on-chip multi-banked video memory for motion and disparity
                  estimation in Multiview Video Coding is proposed. The memory organization (size, banks,
                  sectors, etc.) is driven by an extensive analysis of memory-usage behavior ...

                     transactional memory

                                                                          •

                                                                          •

                     ProgrammingJanuary 2010, pp 37â46https://doi.org/10.1145/1693453.1693460
                                                                        
            
                                                                        
               		
               
                                                                        Atomic sections have been recently introduced as a language construct to improve the
                  programmability of concurrent software. They simplify programming by not requiring
                  the explicit specification of locks for shared data. Typically atomic sections are

                                                                          Minimizing code size via page selection optimization on partitioned memory architectures

                                                                            •

                     for Embedded SystemsSeptember 2013, Article No.: 12, pp 1â10
                                                                          
            
                                                                          
               		
               
                                                                          For 8-bit microcontrollers, bank-switching is commonly used to increase memory capacity.
                  The disadvantage of this technique is that bank (page) selection instructions are
                  introduced when switching active data (program) bank.                                                                             Improving the memory access locality of hybrid MPI applications
                                                                            
            
                                                                              
               
                                                                            • Matthias Diener, 
                                                                              • 
               
                                                                            • Sam White, 
                                                                              • 
               
                                                                            • Laxmikant V. Kale,

                                                                            Maintaining memory access locality is continuing to be a challenge for parallel applications
                  and their runtime environments. By exploiting locality, application performance, resource
                  usage, and performance portability can be improved. The main challenge ...

                                                                              Software Techniques for Scratchpad Memory Management
                                                                              
            
                                                                                
               
                                                                              • Paul Sebexen, 
                                                                                • 
               
                                                                              • Thomas Sohmers
                                                                                • 
            
                                                                              
            
                                                                              MEMSYS '15: Proceedings of the 2015 International Symposium on Memory SystemsOctober 2015, pp 98â102https://doi.org/10.1145/2818950.2818966
                                                                              
            
                                                                              
               		
               
                                                                              Scratchpad memory is commonly encountered in embedded systems as an alternative or
                  supplement to caches [3], however, cache-containing architectures continue to be preferred
                  in many applications due to their general ease of programmability. A language-...
                                                                              
            
                                                                              
            
                                                                              
               
                                                                              
                  
                                                                              
                     
                                                                                
                        
                                                                              • 
                           
                                                                                
                              
                                                                                  
                                 
                                                                                • 1
                                                                                  • 
                                 
                                 
                                                                                • 383
                                                                                  • 
                                 
                                                                                
                              
                                                                                Metrics
                                                                                
                                 
                                                                                Total Citations1
                                                                                
                                 
                                 
                                                                                Total Downloads383
                                                                                
                                 
                                                                                Last 12 Months28

                                                                                Reducing memory buffering overhead in software thread-level speculation
                                                                                
            
                                                                                  
               
                                                                                • Zhen Cao, 
                                                                                  • 
               
                                                                                • Clark Verbrugge
                                                                                  • 
            
                                                                                
            
                                                                                CC 2016: Proceedings of the 25th International Conference on Compiler ConstructionMarch 2016, pp 12â22https://doi.org/10.1145/2892208.2892227
                                                                                
            
                                                                                
               		
               
                                                                                 Software-based, automatic parallelization through Thread-Level Speculation (TLS)
                  has significant practical potential, but also high overhead costs. Traditional "lazy"
                  buffering mechanisms enable strong isolation of speculative threads, but imply large
                  ...

                                                                                  Code cache management in managed language VMs to reduce memory consumption for embedded
                     systems
                                                                                  
            
                                                                                    
               
                                                                                  • Forrest J. Robinson, 
                                                                                    • 
               
                                                                                  • Michael R. Jantz, 
                                                                                    • 
               
                                                                                  • Prasad A. Kulkarni
                                                                                    • 
            
                                                                                  
            
                                                                                  LCTES 2016: Proceedings of the 17th ACM SIGPLAN/SIGBED Conference on Languages, Compilers, Tools,
                     and Theory for Embedded SystemsJune 2016, pp 11â20https://doi.org/10.1145/2907950.2907958
                                                                                  
            
                                                                                  
               		
               
                                                                                   The compiled native code generated by a just-in-time (JIT) compiler in managed language
                  virtual machines (VM) is placed in a region of memory called the code cache. Code
                  cache management (CCM) in a VM is responsible to find and evict methods from the ...

                                                                                    A compiler-automated array compression scheme for optimizing memory intensive programs
                                                                                    
            
                                                                                      
               
                                                                                    • Lixia Liu, 
                                                                                      • 
               
                                                                                    • Zhiyuan Li
                                                                                      • 
            
                                                                                    
            
                                                                                    ICS '10: Proceedings of the 24th ACM International Conference on SupercomputingJune 2010, pp 285â294https://doi.org/10.1145/1810085.1810124
                                                                                    
            
                                                                                    
               		
               
                                                                                    This paper proposes a compiler-automated array compression scheme to reduce the memory
                  bandwidth consumption of programs and thereby to improve their execution speed. Three
                  encoding methods are developed for such compression. Formulas are derived to ...

                                                                                        •

                                                                                        •

                                                                                        Application-specific memory partitioning for joint energy and lifetime optimization

                  is also beneficial for the aging effects caused by Negative Bias Temperature Instability
                  (NBTI), provided that idleness is correctly exploited; unlike energy, aging, ...

                                                                                          CCMC: Code Completion with a Memory Mechanism and a Copy Mechanism
                                                                                          
            
                                                                                            
               
                                                                                          • Hao Yang, 
                                                                                            • 
               
                                                                                          • Li Kuang
                                                                                            • 
            
                                                                                          
            
                                                                                          EASE 2021: Evaluation and Assessment in Software EngineeringJune 2021, pp 129â138https://doi.org/10.1145/3463274.3463332
                                                                                          
            
                                                                                          
               		
               
                                                                                          Code completion tools are increasingly important when developing modern software.
                  Recently, statistical language modeling techniques have achieved great success in
                  the code completion task. However, two major issues with these techniques severely
                  affect ...

                                                                                            Evaluating the effectiveness of program data features for guiding memory management
                                                                                            
            
                                                                                              
               
                                                                                            • T. Chad Effler, 
                                                                                              • 
               
                                                                                            • Brandon Kammerdiener, 
                                                                                              • 
               
                                                                                            • Michael R. Jantz, 
                                                                                              • 
               
                                                                                            • Saikat Sengupta, 
                                                                                              • 
               
                                                                                            • Prasad A. Kulkarni, 
                                                                                              • 
               
                                                                                            • Kshitij A. Doshi, 
                                                                                              • 
               
                                                                                            • Terry Jones
                                                                                              • 
            
                                                                                            
            
                                                                                            MEMSYS '19: Proceedings of the International Symposium on Memory SystemsSeptember 2019, pp 383â395https://doi.org/10.1145/3357526.3357537
                                                                                            
            
                                                                                            
               		
               
                                                                                            Recent trends have led to the adoption of larger and more complex memory systems,
                  often with multiple tiers of memory performance within the same platform. To utilize
                  complex memory systems efficiently, current data management strategies must be altered
                  ...

                                                                                              Efficient code caching to improve performance and energy consumption for java applications
                                                                                              
            
                                                                                                
               
                                                                                              • Yu Sun, 
                                                                                                • 
               
                                                                                              • Wei Zhang
                                                                                                • 
            
                                                                                              
            
                                                                                              CASES '08: Proceedings of the 2008 international conference on Compilers, architectures and synthesis
                     for embedded systemsOctober 2008, pp 119â126https://doi.org/10.1145/1450095.1450115
                                                                                              
            
                                                                                              
               		
               
                                                                                              Java applications rely on Just-In-Time (JIT) compilers or adaptive compilers to generate
                  and optimize binary code at runtime to boost performance. In conventional Java Virtual
                  Machines (JVM), however, the binary code is typically written into the data ...

                                                                                                Application-specific memory performance of a heterogeneous reconfigurable architecture
                                                                                                
            
                                                                                                  
               
                                                                                                • Sean Whitty, 
                                                                                                  • 
               
                                                                                                • Henning Sahlbach, 
                                                                                                  • 
               
                                                                                                • Brady Hurlburt, 
                                                                                                  • 
               
                                                                                                • Rolf Ernst, 
                                                                                                  • 
               
                                                                                                • Wolfram Putzke-RÃ¶ming
                                                                                                  • 
            
                                                                                                
            
                                                                                                DATE '10: Proceedings of the Conference on Design, Automation and Test in EuropeMarch 2010, pp 387â392
                                                                                                
            
                                                                                                
               		
               
                                                                                                Heterogeneous reconfigurable processing architectures are often limited by the speed
                  at which they can access data in external memory. Such architectures are designed
                  for flexibility to support a broad range of target applications, including advanced
                  ...

                                                                                                  Characterizing Optimizations to Memory Access Patterns using Architecture-Independent
                     Program Features
                                                                                                  
            
                                                                                                    
               
                                                                                                  • Aditya Chilukuri, 
                                                                                                    • 
               
                                                                                                  • Josh Milthorpe, 
                                                                                                    • 
               
                                                                                                  • Beau Johnston
                                                                                                    • 
            
                                                                                                  
            
                                                                                                  IWOCL '20: Proceedings of the International Workshop on OpenCLApril 2020, Article No.: 15, pp 1â11https://doi.org/10.1145/3388333.3388656
                                                                                                  
            
                                                                                                  
               		
               
                                                                                                  High-performance computing developers are faced with the challenge of optimizing the
                  performance of OpenCL workloads on diverse architectures. The Architecture-Independent
                  Workload Characterization (AIWC) tool is a plugin for the Oclgrind OpenCL ...

                                                                                                    Toward application-specific memory reconfiguration for energy efficiency
                                                                                                    
            
                                                                                                      
               
                                                                                                    • Pietro Cicotti, 
                                                                                                      • 
               
                                                                                                    • Laura Carrington, 
                                                                                                      • 
               
                                                                                                    • Andrew Chien
                                                                                                      • 
            
                                                                                                    
            
                                                                                                    E2SC '13: Proceedings of the 1st International Workshop on Energy Efficient SupercomputingNovember 2013, Article No.: 2, pp 1â8https://doi.org/10.1145/2536430.2536434
                                                                                                    
            
                                                                                                    
               		
               
                                                                                                    The end of Dennard scaling has made energy-efficiency a critical challenge in the
                  continued increase of computing performance. An important approach to increasing energy-efficiency
                  is hardware customization. In this study we explore the opportunity for ...

                                                                                                      A framework for application guidance in virtual memory systems
                                                                                                      
            
                                                                                                        
               
                                                                                                      • Michael R. Jantz, 
                                                                                                        • 
               
                                                                                                      • Carl Strickland, 
                                                                                                        • 
               
                                                                                                      • Karthik Kumar, 
                                                                                                        • 
               
                                                                                                      • Martin Dimitrov, 
                                                                                                        • 
               
                                                                                                      • Kshitij A. Doshi
                                                                                                        • 
            
                                                                                                      
            
                                                                                                      VEE '13: Proceedings of the 9th ACM SIGPLAN/SIGOPS international conference on Virtual execution
                     environmentsMarch 2013, pp 155â166https://doi.org/10.1145/2451512.2451543
                                                                                                      
            
                                                                                                      
               		
               
                                                                                                      This paper proposes a collaborative approach in which applications can provide guidance
                  to the operating system regarding allocation and recycling of physical memory. The
                  operating system incorporates this guidance to decide which physical page should ...
                                                                                                      
               
                                                                                                      
               
                                                                                                      
            
                                                                                                      
            
                                                                                                      
               
                                                                                                      Also Published in:
                                                                                                      ACM SIGPLAN Notices: Volume 48 Issue 7, July 2013

                                                                                                        Published By ACM
                                                                                                        
         
                                                                                                        
      
                                                                                                        
      
                                                                                                        
         
                                                                                                        
            
                                                                                                        Extending database task schedulers for multi-threaded application code
                                                                                                        
            
                                                                                                          
               
                                                                                                        • Florian Wolf, 
                                                                                                          • 
               
                                                                                                        • Iraklis Psaroudakis, 
                                                                                                          • 
               
                                                                                                        • Norman May, 
                                                                                                          • 
               
                                                                                                        • Anastasia Ailamaki, 
                                                                                                          • 
               
                                                                                                        • Kai-Uwe Sattler
                                                                                                          • 
            
                                                                                                        
            
                                                                                                        SSDBM '15: Proceedings of the 27th International Conference on Scientific and Statistical Database
                     ManagementJune 2015, Article No.: 25, pp 1â12https://doi.org/10.1145/2791347.2791379
                                                                                                        
            
                                                                                                        
               		
               
                                                                                                        Modern databases can run application logic defined in stored procedures inside the
                  database server to improve application speed. The SQL standard specifies how to call
                  external stored routines implemented in programming languages, such as C, C++, or
                  ...

                                                                                                          BLeak: automatically debugging memory leaks in web applications
                                                                                                          
            
                                                                                                            
               
                                                                                                          • John Vilk, 
                                                                                                            • 
               
                                                                                                          • Emery D. Berger
                                                                                                            • 
            
                                                                                                          
            
                                                                                                          PLDI 2018: Proceedings of the 39th ACM SIGPLAN Conference on Programming Language Design and
                     ImplementationJune 2018, pp 15â29https://doi.org/10.1145/3192366.3192376
                                                                                                          
            
                                                                                                          
               		
               
                                                                                                          Despite the presence of garbage collection in managed languages like JavaScript, memory
                  leaks remain a serious problem. In the context of web applications, these leaks are
                  especially pervasive and difficult to debug. Web application memory leaks can ...

                                                                                                            Static memory management for efficient mobile sensing applications
                                                                                                            
            
                                                                                                              
               
                                                                                                            • Farley Lai, 
                                                                                                              • 
               
                                                                                                            • Daniel Schmidt, 
                                                                                                              • 
               
                                                                                                            • Octav Chipara
                                                                                                              • 
            
                                                                                                            
            
                                                                                                            EMSOFT '15: Proceedings of the 12th International Conference on Embedded SoftwareOctober 2015, pp 187â196
                                                                                                            
            
                                                                                                            
               		
               
                                                                                                            Memory management is a crucial aspect of mobile sensing applications that must process
                  high-rate data streams in an energy-efficient manner. Our work is done in the context
                  of synchronous data-flow models in which applications are implemented as a graph ...

                                                                                                              A methodology for efficient code optimizations and memory management
                                                                                                              
            
                                                                                                                
               
                                                                                                              • Vasilios Kelefouras, 
                                                                                                                • 
               
                                                                                                              • Karim Djemame
                                                                                                                • 
            
                                                                                                              
            
                                                                                                              CF '18: Proceedings of the 15th ACM International Conference on Computing FrontiersMay 2018, pp 105â112https://doi.org/10.1145/3203217.3203274
                                                                                                              
            
                                                                                                              
               		
               
                                                                                                              The key to optimizing software is the correct choice, order as well parameters of
                  optimizations-transformations, which has remained an open problem in compilation research
                  for decades for various reasons. First, most of the compilation subproblems-...
